Spoken Word
We Are the Dury

Release date: April 2005

Just like The Apex Tapes, this CD was given to radio stations for hosts to interview the band; but this time the questions dug deeper into the band’s lore and the meanings behind each track from their then-latest album, Demon Days.

Tracklist:

Intro.  “The Gorillaz story is now something of a legend. The take of a world-storming band, composed of the four musicians: Murdoc, Russel, Noodle and 2D. Their ascent to stardom was swift, drafting in superlative collaborators to record their award winning debut album ‘Gorillaz‘, a fantastic collision of dub reggae, punk and hip-hop. This was accompanied by a relentless array of top-notch videos and Gorillaz subsequently won countless awards around the globe. Having been nominated in five categories, Gorillaz then gave a breathtaking performance at the 2002 Brit Awards show. This was rounded off with an extensive Gorillaz American Tour.

However, since then there has been only silence from the Gorillaz camp. Now, as they prepare to release their new album, we’ve been given the opportunity to ask them what happened and discover what they’ve been up to since their last appearance.”

[untitled]
So, where have you been and what have you been up to?
2D, what did you do in your off time?
You recorded most of the album in your own Kong studios. How did you first find this building?
Your website, Gorillaz.com, gives your online audience access to Kong Studios. Tell us about the thinking behind this.
OK, Murdoc, you’ve had your ciggy and you’ve got your beer. Let’s get down to it and talk through the new album. How long did Demon Days take to record?
Let’s now go through the album track by track. First up, suitably enough, Intro.
Track 2 is Last Living Souls. Russel?
Next up, Kids with Guns. A slower track, yes?
Track 4, O Green World. Noodle, talk us through this one, please….
Let’s talk about the collaboration with DJ Danger Mouse. Was he involved on the next track, Dirty Harry?
Next is the first single, Feelgood Inc.
El Manana is next, Spanish for ‘tomorrow’, I believe.
Next track is Every Planet we Reach is Dead. Sounds a bit sinister….
OK, November has come. Russel, can you start us off on this one?
All Alone follows, Track 10 on the new Gorillaz CD Demon Days.
Next up, White Light.
There’s an interesting story about how the next track, Dare, got its title….
Noodle, tell us about Fire Coming out of a Monkey’s Head
Back to you, Russel, for Don’t Get Lost in Heaven
Now, the title track, Demon Days. Noodle?
OK, those are the tracks covered. How would you say this new record differs from the first Gorillaz’ album, Russel?
Who chose the single?
There are a number of guest collaborations on the album. How did they come about?
Are you going to tour this album?
Did you ever feel that the first album would be as successful as it actually was?
But why, do you think, it was so successful?
When did you know that you had really arrived as celebrities?
Have you, finally, learned anything from your experience?
Rise of the Ogre
